standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

hints.content: There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
###Place Value  We can think in terms of tenths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}8.4 - 6\\\\ &=8.4 - 6.0\\\\ &=84\text{ tenths} - 60\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=24\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=2.4 \end{align}$

###Place value table  Let's line up the numbers by their decimal places.   Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{8}$ |$.$ | $\blueE4$  $\maroonD{6}$ | $.$ |$\maroonD0$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.   | Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{8}$ |$.$ | $\blueE4$ $-$  | $\maroonD6$ | $.$ | $\maroonD0$  | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$ | $2$| $.$ | $4$
There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.
###Place Value  We can think in terms of tenths:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}9.1 - 7\\\\ &=9.1 - 7.0\\\\ &=91\text{ tenths} - 70\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=21\text{ tenths}\\\\ &=2.1 \end{align}$

###Place value table  Let's line up the numbers by their decimal places.   Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{9}$ |$.$ | $\blueE1$  $\maroonD{7}$ | $.$ |$\maroonD0$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.   | Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | -  | $\blueE{9}$ |$.$ | $\blueE1$ $-$  | $\maroonD7$ | $.$ | $\maroonD0$  | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$ | $2$| $.$ | $1$
There are many ways to solve this problem. Let's see two ways we can solve it.

Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | -  $\blueE{1}$ | $\blueE{0}$ |$.$ | $\blueE0$  | $\maroonD{3}$ | $.$ |$\maroonD7$  Now, let's subtract each place value column.  | Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths - | - | - | - | - | $\cancel{\blueE{1}}$ | $\overset{9}{\cancel{\blueE{0}}}$ |$.$ | $\overset{10}{\cancel{\blueE{0}}}$ $-$  |  | $\maroonD3$ | $.$ | $\maroonD7$ | $\underline{~~~~}$ | $\underline{~~~~}$|  | $\underline{~~~~}$  |  | $6$| $.$ | $3$
